gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class ControlSlider

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ViewControl
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ControlSlider
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class ControlSlider
extends ViewControl

This class is an ViewControl (ActiveJPanel) with a generic slider for use by ViewComponents. It includes a hook to send out messages when the slider has been adjusted.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

SLIDER_CHANGED

public static final java.lang.String SLIDER_CHANGED
"Slider Changed" - This is a messaging String sent out whenever the slider "knob" has changed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SLIDER_VALUE

public static final java.lang.String SLIDER_VALUE
"Slider Value" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about what value is at the current "knob" position. The value that this key references is a primative float within the range of slider values.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RANGE

public static final java.lang.String RANGE
"Range" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the minimum and maximum values returned by this slider. The value that this key references is of type floatPoint2D.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MAJOR_TICK

public static final java.lang.String MAJOR_TICK
"Major Tick" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the spacing of major tickmarks on the slider. The value that this key references is a primative float.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MINOR_TICK

public static final java.lang.String MINOR_TICK
"Minor Tick" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the spacing of minor (shorter) tickmarks on the slider. The value that this key references is a primative float.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STEP

public static final java.lang.String STEP
"Step" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the size per division or number of divisions the slider will be divided into. If this value expresses number of divisions, the value that this key references is a primative int. If this value expresses the actual size of the division (as a percent), the value that this key references is a primative float.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ControlSlider

public ControlSlider()
Default constructor specifies no title but initializes slider with range (0.0,100.0) and interval of 0.1. The default slider is useful for use as an intensity (color) slider.

ControlSlider

public ControlSlider(float min,
                     float max,
                     float step_size)
Constructor for slider with no title but has an initialized range [min,max] and step.

Parameters:
min - Slider minimum
max - Slider maximum
step_size - Percent of interval per step, on interval (0,1]

ControlSlider

public ControlSlider(float min,
                     float max,
                     int numsteps)
Constructor for slider with no title but has an initialized range [min,max] and step.

Parameters:
min - Slider minimum
max - Slider maximum
numsteps - Percent of interval per step, on interval (0,1]

ControlSlider

public ControlSlider(java.lang.String title)
Same functionality as default constructor, only this constructor allows for title specification.

Parameters:
title - - title of slider

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IViewControl
Overrides:
getObjectState in class ViewControl
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

public void setControlValue(java.lang.Object value)
Set the slider position, same functionality as setValue().

Specified by:
setControlValue in interface IViewControl

getControlValue

public java.lang.Object getControlValue()
Get value associated slider knob position, same functionality as getValue().

Specified by:
getControlValue in interface IViewControl
Specified by:
getControlValue in class ViewControl
Returns:
Float value corresponding to slider position.

getValue

public float getValue()
getValue() returns the value associated with the slider "knob" position.

Returns:
value on interval [range min, range max]

setValue

public void setValue(float new_val)
This method sets the slider "knob" to the specified value. If an invalid value is entered, the knob is moved to the nearest valid value. The value parameter should be on the interval [range min, range max], THIS IS NOT A PERCENTAGE PARAMETER.

Parameters:
new_val - - position of "knob"

setStep

public void setStep(float step_size)
This method specifies how to divide the range into steps. The step is specified by a percentage of the original interval.

Parameters:
step_size - The percentage of the interval per step. This value must be on the range (0,1)

setStep

public void setStep(int numsteps)
This method specifies how to divide the range into steps.

Parameters:
numsteps - The number of steps on this interval.

getNumSteps

public int getNumSteps()
This method returns the number of steps this slider is divided into.

Returns:
number of steps

getStepSize

public float getStepSize()
This method returns the size of the steps. The value returned is a percent on the interval (0,1].

Returns:
step size between (0,1]

setRange

public void setRange(float xmin,
                     float xmax)
Sets range of slider to specified range. The increment between the minimun and maximum is determined by the setPrecision method.

Parameters:
xmin - - range minimum
xmax - - range maximum

setMajorTickSpace

public void setMajorTickSpace(float m_spacing)
Set the spacing for the "long" tickmarks. Enter a percentage of the interval that the major ticks should be spaced. Ex. spacing = .2f would result in 5 major ticks since .2 => 1/5

Parameters:
m_spacing - - major tick spacing

setMinorTickSpace

public void setMinorTickSpace(float m_spacing)
Set the spacing for the "short" tickmarks.Enter a percentage of the interval that the minor ticks should be spaced. Ex. spacing = .1f would result in 10 minor ticks since .1 => 1/10

Parameters:
m_spacing - - minor tick spacing

getMajorTickSpace

public float getMajorTickSpace()
Get the spacing for the "long" tickmarks. Returns a percentage of the interval that the major ticks should be spaced. Ex. spacing = .2f would result in 5 major ticks since .2 => 1/5

Returns:
spacing - major tick spacing as a percent between [0,1]

getMinorTickSpace

public float getMinorTickSpace()
Get the spacing for the "short" tickmarks. Returns a percentage of the interval that the minor ticks should be spaced. Ex. spacing = .1f would result in 10 minor ticks since .1 => 1/10

Returns:
spacing - minor tick spacing as a percent between [0,1]

showTicks

public void showTicks(boolean showticks)
Method to turn on(true)/off(false) the display of tickmarks. Note: This turns off both major and minor tickmarks. To turn off only major/minor, set the major/minor tick spacing to zero.

Parameters:
showticks -

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
For testing purposes only. If "cm" is passed as an argument, the ControlManager will link controls.
